channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: White House personnel office recommends telework during Army celebration and parade
item.description: The Office of Personnel Management recommends that federal agencies allow employees to telework this week.

item.title: Sen. John Fetterman bashes fellow Democrats for not condemning L.A. protest violence
item.description: Sen. John Fetterman criticized his fellow Democrats for not condemning the violence used by the anti-ICE protesters in Los Angeles.

item.title: Trump’s chaotic economy is causing headaches for Democrats in New Jersey's governor race
item.description: The crowded contest in the Garden State shows how hard it is to address pocketbook issues.

item.title: ‘Anything can happen’: Trump doesn't seem fazed by recession worries
item.description: Trump has blamed shaky economic numbers on his predecessor.

item.title: Warren Buffett shocks shareholders by announcing his intention to retire at the end of the year
item.description: Earlier, Buffett warned Saturday about the dire global consequences of President Donald Trump's tariffs.

item.title: Democrats look to Trump's poor economic numbers with anxious optimism

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
